titlepage.titleproper: Register of the King Petar II Karađorđevic miscellaneous papers, 1943-1974
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: King Petar II Karađorđevic' miscellaneous papers,

origination.label: Creator
origination.persname: Petar II Karađorđevic', King of Yugoslavia, 1923-1970.

did.abstract: Correspondence and announcements, relating to the Yugoslav exile government during World War II, resistance movements in occupied Yugoslavia, politics and government, and Yugoslav emigre politics. Photocopy.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], King Petar II Karađorđevic miscellaneous papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1974.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and announcements, relating to the Yugoslav exile government during World War II, resistance movements in occupied Yugoslavia, politics and government, and Yugoslav emigre politics. Photocopy.

did.unittitle: Gavrilo, Patriarch of the Serbian Orthodox Church
"Announcement," from the office of His Majesty King Peter II, London, 1956 June 10 (in Serbian)
Christmas Greeting, by King Peter II, Cannes, 1967 December 21 (in Serbian)
Open Letter, "Dear Brother Serbs," from the Heir Apparent Crown Prince Alexander Karadjordjevich, London, 1974 (in Serbian)
Sound recording of King Peter II luncheon on Yugoslav Liberty Day

scopecontent.p: Yugoslav Liberty Day luncheon at the Commodore Hotel in New York in celebration of King Peter II's 18th birthday. Several speeches are made decrying the Nazi aggression in Europe in opposition to liberty.3 discs

did.unittitle: Sound recording of address by King Peter II of Yugoslavia

scopecontent.p: King Peter II speaks to the American people from a Washington, D.C. studio. He holds that America is a beacon of liberty for the people of Yugoslavia. He then details the defense of Yugoslavia against the Nazi invasion, including the military leaders still in the country commanding the Yugoslav forces. Concluding, he speaks to people of Yugoslavian descent in his native language. Audio says this program was presented by the Blue Network. Concluding side has NBC chimes. 2 discs
